abstract: Google is bringing three new brands to its digital advertising initiative, an attempt to get marketers to think of technology as their best asset.
snippet: Google is bringing three new brands to its digital advertising initiative, an attempt to get marketers to think of technology as their best asset.
lead_paragraph: GOOGLE executives, declaring themselves pleased with the results of an unusual advertising initiative last year, are bringing out a Version 2.0, again teaming with agencies and marketers to try demonstrating that technology is not incompatible with traditional Madison Avenue sales strategies like emotional storytelling.

headline.main: In Upgrade, Google Adds to Model for Mobile Marketing
headline.print_headline: In an Upgrade, Google Adds to Its Model for Mobile Marketing

abstract: Time Warner will spin off its magazine titles, Facebook will revamp its News Feed and Google executives try to bring advertisers into social media.
snippet: Time Warner will spin off its magazine titles, Facebook will revamp its News Feed and Google executives try to bring advertisers into social media.
lead_paragraph: Time Warner announced Wednesday that it would spin off its Time Inc. magazine unit into a separate, publicly traded company, Amy Chozick writes. The announcement came hours after negotiations on a possible merger between Meredith Corporation and many Time Inc. titles fell through. The deal did not work out in part because of Time Inc.’s concern about flagship titles Time, Sports Illustrated, Fortune and Money, which Meredith had decided not to pursue. Time Warner found it made more economic sense to spin off all its titles rather than retain a few of them, a person with knowledge of the negotiations said. Time Inc. is the nation’s largest magazine publisher, and the breakdown in talks threw into sharp relief how once-glamorous magazines have become troubled assets.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Time Warner to Spin Off Time Inc., and Facebook’s New Look
